definition: as matters stand/things having reached this stage
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: With things as such , we‘ll have to let things slide.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今，我们也只好顺其自然了。

sentences.english: But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣就对他们说，我父作事到如今，我也作事。

sentences.english: It's time to make a few things clear.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今有几点必须澄清。

sentences.english: Till present, this case is still unsettled and laid aside by City Intermediate Court, without any result.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今，此案在市中院依然石沉大海，没有结论。

sentences.english: What's done is done. Further reprimanding him will not fix anything.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今木已成舟，你再训斥他也没有用了。

sentences.english: Now you're acting like you still in charge.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今你还以为你是老大。

sentences.english: With things as such , we'll have to let things slide.
sentences.chinese: 事到如今，咱们也只好顺其自然了。

definition: if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
when things come to a head (idiom)
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
